sectionText: Title: Roman Medicine Description: This class will read selections from a diverse range of texts, both poetry and prose, from authors such as Cicero, Celsus, Lucretius, Cato, Varro, Pliny the Elder, and Sammonicus Serenus. We will examine Roman ideas about doctors, medicine, the body, and disease, and will explore the impact that these ideas had on Roman culture in general.   This section is for Undergraduates.
